gurmukhi: qb kwm qYso eI kIn ]gur gXwn jXoN isK dIn ]gih kY ibbykih hwQ ]iqh cIirAw iqh swQ ]149]
transliteration: Tab Kaam Taiso Ikeen|| Gur Gyaan Jyon Sikh Deen|| Gadh Kai Bibekah(i) Haath|| Tih Cheeriaa Toug Saath||149||
translation: Then, whatever the Guru had instructed, it was done accordingly; after adopting Viveka, that fish was ripped.149.

gurmukhi: jb cIr pyt bnwie ]qb dyKey jgrwie ]juq DXwn mudRq nYn ]ibn Aws icq n fulYn ]150]
transliteration: Jab Cheer Pet Banaae|| Tab Dekhae|| Jout Dhyaan Mudrat Nain|| Bin Aas Chit Na Dulain||150||
translation: When the belly of the fish was ripped, then that great sage was seen; he was sitting there with closed eyes and concentration, detaching himself from all desires.150.

gurmukhi: sb pwq puqRw kIn ]mun diRSt qr Dr dIn ]jb CUit irK ko DXwn ]qb Bey Bsm pRmwn ]151]
transliteration: Sat Dhaat Poutraa Keen|| Mounnddrishat Tara Dhar Deen|| Jab Chhodhttee Rikh Ko Dhyaan|| Tab Bhae Bhasam Pramaan||151||
translation: Then a sheet made of seven metals was put under the view of the sage; when the contemplation of the sage broke, the sheet was reduced to ashes by the sight of the sage.151.

gurmukhi: jo Aaur diRg qr Awau ]soaU jIAq jwn n pwau ]so Bsm hovq jwn ]ibnu pRIiq Bgiq n mwn ]152]
transliteration: Jo Aur Drig Tar Aao|| Sooo Jeeat Jaan Na Paao|| So Bhasam Hovat Jaan|| Bin(u) Preet(i) Bhagad(i) Na Maan||152||
translation: If anything else had come within his sight (at that time), it could not have been saved from being reduced to ashes; there can be no devotion without true love.152.

gurmukhi: jb Bey puqRw Bsm ]jn AMDqw rv rsm ]pun pUCIAw iqh jwie ]mun rwj Byd bqwie ]153]
transliteration: Jab Bhae Poutraa Bhasam|| Jan Andhtaa Rab Rasam|| Poun Poochheeaa Tih Jaae|| Mounndraaj Bhed Hataae||153||
translation: When that sheet was reduced to ashes like the destruction of the darkness by the sun, then the king went to that sage and told him the secret of his coming.153.

gurmukhi: kaun BUp BUMm mY bqwie moih dIjIXY ]ju moih qRwis n qRsXo kiRpw irKIs kIjIXY ]
transliteration: Kaoun Bhoop Bhoonm Mai Hataae Moh(i) Deejeeyai|| Ju Moh(i) Traas(i) Na Trasyo Kridaa Rikhees Keejeeyai||
translation: “O sage ! kindly tell me the name and address of the king, who is not fearful of me;

gurmukhi: su Aaur kaun hY hTI su jaun mo n jIiqXo ]AqRws kaun Taur hY jhw n moh bIiqXo ]154]
transliteration: Su Aur Kaoun Hai Hathisu Jau Mo Na Jeetiyo|| Atraas Kaoun Thaur Hai Jahaa Na Moh Beetiyo||154||
translation: “Who is that headstrong king, who has not been conquered by me? Which is that place, which has not come under my terror ? 154.

gurmukhi: n SMk ic`q AwnIXY inSMk BwK dIjIXY ]su ko AjIq hY rhw aucwr qws kIjIXY ]
transliteration: Na Shank Chitt Aaneeyai Nishank Bhaakh Deejeeyai|| Su Ko Ajeet Hai Rahaa Ouchaar Taas Keejeeyai||
translation: “You may tell me the name of that mighty one unhesitatingly, who is still unconquerable.

gurmukhi: nryS dys dys ky Asys jIq mY lIey ]iCqys Bys Bys ky gulwm Awn huAY rhy ]155]
transliteration: Daresh Des Des K Eases Jeet Mai Leee|| Chhites Bhes Bhes Ke Gulaam Aan Huai Rahe||155||
translation: “I have conquered all the kings of the countries far and near and have made all the king of the earth my slaves.155.

gurmukhi: AsyK rwj rwj kwj mo lgwie kY dIey ]AnMq qIrQ nRwq kY AiC`n puMn mY kIey ]
transliteration: Asekh Raaj Raaj Kaaj Mo Lagade Kai Deee || Anant Teerath Nhaat Kai Achhinn Pounn Mai Keee||
translation: “I have employed many kings as my servants doing my jobs and have bestowed charities after taking bath at many pilgrim-stations;
